_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four meditators [sn34.20-27:1.11]: One meditator is skilled in remaining in immersion but not in emerging from it.
One meditator is skilled in emerging from immersion but not in remaining in it.
One meditator is skilled in neither remaining in immersion nor emerging from it.
One meditator is skilled in both remaining in immersion and emerging from it.
The eight discourses [sn34.20-27:1.11]: Absorption One on the Perception of Light
Absorption Two on the Perception of Day
Absorption Three on the Perception of Brightness
Absorption Four on the Perception of the Beautiful
Absorption Five on the Perception of the Dimension of the Infinite Space
Absorption Six on the Perception of the Dimension of the Infinite Consciousness
Absorption Seven on the Perception of Nothingness
Absorption Eight on Remaining and Emergence, Etc.
